name: Mathematica-Fa14
body:
All workshops will be held in L440 Digital Computer Laboratory, an EWS computer laboratory in the basement.  There is no sign-up for this series—walk-ins are welcome and encouraged!

# Access to *Mathematica*

[*Wolfram Mathematica*](http://www.wolfram.com/mathematica/) is available for students at the University of Illinois in the [Engineering Workstation](it.engineering.illinois.edu/ews) computer laboratories, and also for download from the [UI Webstore](https://webstore.illinois.edu/Shop/product.aspx?zpid=2633).

# [Introduction to *Wolfram Mathematica*](#intro)
### Nov. 13, 10:00 am–Noon • DCL L440

This workshop targets students who have some background in programming concepts (loops, functions, and variables).  (If you know MATLAB, Python, or another language, you'll be fine.)  We will conduct a hands-on walkthrough of what *Mathematica* has to offer and then work through some applications of *Mathematica*'s capabilities.

We will cover the following topics:

- Variables, data types, tables, functions
- Plotting
- Rules (the core concept of *Mathematica*)
- Built-in libraries & technical data
- Equation and differential equation solution
- Physical applications

Notebooks:

- [Basic Tour 1](https://github.com/uiuc-cse/mathematica-fa14/raw/gh-pages/lessons/basics-1-algebraics-symbolics-numerics-graphics.nb)
- [Basic Tour 2](https://github.com/uiuc-cse/mathematica-fa14/raw/gh-pages/lessons/basics-2-datasets-optimization-lists.nb)
- [DNA String (Replacement Rules)](https://github.com/uiuc-cse/mathematica-fa14/raw/gh-pages/lessons/dna_string.nb)
- [Heat Equation (ODE Solution)](https://github.com/uiuc-cse/mathematica-fa14/raw/gh-pages/lessons/heat-eqn-1d.nb)
- [Pendulum (ODE Solution)](https://github.com/uiuc-cse/mathematica-fa14/raw/gh-pages/lessons/pendulum.nb)
- [Hanging Chain (Special Functions, ODE Solution)](https://github.com/uiuc-cse/mathematica-fa14/raw/gh-pages/lessons/hanging-chain.nb)
- [Steam Table (Interpolation)](https://github.com/uiuc-cse/mathematica-fa14/raw/gh-pages/lessons/steam.nb)
- [Exercises](https://github.com/uiuc-cse/mathematica-fa14/raw/gh-pages/lessons/exercises-basic.nb)

Code Snippets:

    data = "AGCTTTTCATTCTGACTGCAACGGGCAATATGTCTCTGTGTGGATTAAAAAAAGAGTGTCTGATAGCAGC"

    MorseList = {".-", "-...", "-.-.", "-..", ".", "..-.", "--.", "....","..", ".---", "-.-", ".-..", "--", "-.", "---", ".--.", "--.-",".-.", "...", "-", "..-", "...-", ".--", "-..-", "-.--", "--..","----.", "-----", ".----", "..---", "...--","....-", ".....","-....", "--...", "---.."};

    steamdata = Import["http://www.ohio.edu/mechanical/thermo/property_tables/H2O/H2O_TempSat.xls"][[1]] // TableForm
    steamT   = Part[steamdata[[1, 4 ;; 52, 1]]];
    steamP   = Part[steamdata[[1, 4 ;; 52, 2]]];
    steamVf  = Part[steamdata[[1, 4 ;; 52, 3]]];
    steamVg  = Part[steamdata[[1, 4 ;; 52, 4]]];
    steamUf  = Part[steamdata[[1, 4 ;; 52, 5]]];
    steamUg  = Part[steamdata[[1, 4 ;; 52, 6]]];
    steamHf  = Part[steamdata[[1, 4 ;; 52, 7]]];
    steamHfg = Part[steamdata[[1, 4 ;; 52, 8]]];
    steamHg  = Part[steamdata[[1, 4 ;; 52, 9]]];
    steamSf  = Part[steamdata[[1, 4 ;; 52, 10]]];
    steamSfg = Part[steamdata[[1, 4 ;; 52, 11]]];
    steamSg  = Part[steamdata[[1, 4 ;; 52, 12]]];

# [Resources](#resources)

- [CSE Handout on *Mathematica* Functions](https://github.com/uiuc-cse/mathematica-fa14/blob/gh-pages/lessons/handout-basics.pdf?raw=true)
- [*Mathematica* StackExchange](https://mathematica.stackexchange.com/)
- [Wolfram Language Reference](http://reference.wolfram.com/language/)
- [10 Tips for Writing Fast *Mathematica* Code](http://blog.wolfram.com/2011/12/07/10-tips-for-writing-fast-mathematica-code/)
- [Wolfram Demonstrations Project](http://demonstrations.wolfram.com/)
